channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024020974
item.description:
Report X-2024020974

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-04
  • City: YUMA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came out of trailer wet/leaking. Plastic pail/bucket was immediately placed inside a hazmat tote to prevent further damage/leakage. DescribePack: Plastic Bucket had loose caps. No tape/clips were used to secure the lid in place. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Plastic bucket was placed inside a red hazmat tote in the upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020893
item.description:
Report X-2024020893

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-02
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found during unload phase. Wet, and was placed in lined hazmat tote and taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose caps cause inner container to leak and damage outer container. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: package was placed in lined hazmat tote with orientation arrows up.

item.title: Report X-2024020344
item.description:
Report X-2024020344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to the damage cage for further inspection. Upon inspection there was no internal packing to provide support; there was too much air space for items to move around. Which caused the cap on one of the gal jugs to loosen during transit. Approximately 5 ounces leaked out. DescribePack: There was too much air space for items to move around which caused the cap to loosen during transit. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package placed in a hazmat lined totes further inspected by a hazmat certified employee.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the unloading process, the hazardous material had a soiled base causing for an inspection. Package was taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: The cap caused an internal leak. Cap seal was attached to the cap. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazardous tote and bag and taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2024020305
item.description:
Report E-2024020305

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-24
  • City: HEBER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Circle K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 10:49 ET, personnel with Circle K contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning a diesel spill that was released at Circle K #2700428 located at 1953 AZ-260, Heber-Overgaard, AZ 85928, USA. The caller stated that during a gas delivery the driver overfilled and impacted asphalt and concrete. At the request of the caller, ERTS will dispatch a contractor to complete the cleanup. Graymar observed a 40-gallon release of diesel fuel to a 30' by 30' area of pavement that had absorbents applied prior to arrival. Two bags of absorbents were used to contain the liquid, impacted absorbents were containerized into (1) 55-gallon metal drum and is being removed from the site to be staged at Graymar's facility until disposal can be coordinated with ERTS.

item.title: Report E-2024020350
item.description:
Report E-2024020350

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: BUCKEYE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver connected drop gun to the ground connection per drivers statement. Driver connected hose to drop gun and tried to remove cap from other end but had issues. Driver removed hose from other end at drop gun to twist hose to loosen cap. Caps comes loose and the driver connects to trailer connection. Driver open external then internal and he turned around and about 20 gals of diesel was coming out of the hose. Driver failed to reconnect hose to drop gun fitting and didn't trace his hoses out to make sure they were connected before opening his valves.

item.title: Report I-2023110069
item.description:
Report I-2023110069

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pax gave Flight Attendant a smoking vape device and she brought it to the forward Lavatory where all the Flight Attendants poured water into the Fire Containment bag (FCB) and then we sealed the device inside and took the FCB to a cart in the aft galley.
